Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that an old camera found in the deep ocean revealed horrifying Titanic photos, when in fact, no such camera or photos exist.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or mention of any old camera being found in the deep ocean.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the existence of horrifying Titanic photos from an old camera found in the deep ocean is a possibility, without any basis or evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no old camera with Titanic photos was found in the deep ocean.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the claim is a result of advertising arbitrage, where misleading information is used to attract readers and generate revenue through slideshow clicks.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting misleading information and changing the story's title from the advertisement to the actual content.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
